City Council
Regular Meeting
12/23/2024 5:30 PM
Sullivan Chamber
Cambridge City Hall   795 Massachusetts Ave   Cambridge, MA 02139
Downloads:
Agenda Summary Agenda Packet
Final Actions Minutes
Call to Order
Roll Call
Pledge of Allegiance
Public Comment
I. City Manager's Agenda
1. CMA 2024 #268 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a request for authorization to allow the Purchasing Agent to award a five (5) year contract to a successful bidder on the School Bus Transportation Bid. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]

AND CMA PLACED ON FILE

City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. School Bus Purchasing Order 12.23.24
II. Policy Order and Resolution List
1. POR 2024 #161 : That the City Manager is requested to direct the City Solicitor to provide the City Council with a legal opinion on the City Council’s ability to levy a tax or fine on store fronts and commercial properties that remain vacant for more than two years, including any applicable definitions of “vacancy” and relevant legal precedents, and provide such opinion no later than the February 17th City Council meeting. Order Adopted as Amended [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
2. POR 2024 #162 : That the City Manager is requested to direct Community Development Department (CDD) staff to draft proposed amendments to the Cannabis Business Permitting Ordinance that would accomplish adding select HCA requirements into the ordinance so the city can waive the HCA requirement and that the City Manager is requested to ask the CDD staff to draft a zoning amendment to remove the repackaging prohibition. Order Adopted [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
3. POR 2024 #163 : That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct Community Development to prepare updated Multi Family Housing Zoning language and report back to the Ordinance Committee, not later than January 16, 2025. Order Adopted [8 to 1]
Policy Order Printout
III. Calendar
Unfinished Business
1. ORDD-2023-2 : An Ordinance 2023 #8B has been received from City Clerk, relative to Amend Chapter 14.04 – Fair Housing. PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 2, 2023. FURTHER AMENDED IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 6, 2023. No action can be taken until the State Legislature approves the related Special Act.

NO ACTION TAKEN

b. Fair Housing Ordinance lanugage passed to a second reading on October 2 2023 and further amended on November 6 2023 8B
2. ORD 2024 # 5 : An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to Flexible Parking Corridor Zoning Petition. ADOPTED AS A CITY COUNCIL ZONING PETITION AND REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE AND PLANNING BOARD IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 21, 2024. PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL DECEMBER 2, 2024 ORDAINED [Unanimous]
a. Flexible Parking Corridor Zoning Text_20241021_Final
c. 241202.Flexible Parking Corridor Zoning Ordinance 2024-5 - First Publication

a. CLEAN_PTDM_Ordinance_Amendments
b. MARKUP_PTDM_Ordinance_Amendments
d. 241202.Parking and Transportation Demand Management - PTDM - Ordinance 2024-6 - First Publication
4. ORD 2024 # 7 : An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to the Commercial Parking Space Permits Municipal Ordinance. REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 21, 2024. PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL DECEMBER 2, 2024 ORDAINED [Unanimous]
a. CLEAN_Commercial_Parking_Space_Permits_Amendments
b. MARKUP_Commercial_Parking_Space_Permits_Amendments
d. 241202.Commercial Parking Space Permits Ordinance 2024-7 - First Publication
5. ORD 2024 # 8 : An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to proposed amendments to the Cycling Safety Ordinance to extend the deadline associated with the completion of those sections of the ordinance that are required to be completed by May 1, 2026. NO ACTION TAKEN
a. CSO As amended in full Council 10.21.2024 Clean Version
b. CSO Mark-up As Amended in Full Council 10.21.2024 to reflect new date of 11.30.2026
c. 241216.CSO As amended in full Council 10.21.2024 Clean Version - Ordinance 2024-8 - First Publication
IV. Applications and Petitions
1. APP 2024 #39 : An application was received from Katinka Jeffs, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises numbered 6-R Eaton Street; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services, Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. No response has been received from the neighborhood association. Order Adopted [Unanimous]
Application and Petitions Printout
a. 6-R Eaton Street
2. APP 2024 #40 : An application was received from John Winslow, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises numbered 8 Whittier Street; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services, Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. Response has been received from a neighborhood association not in the area of the application address. Order Adopted [8 to 1]
Application and Petitions Printout
a. 8 Whittier Street
b. Ann Tennis in Highlands-Quad response Curb Cut Application for 8 Whittier Street

VII. Committee Reports
1. Minutes of Dec 17, 2024 12:00 PM Accepted [Unanimous]

REPORT AND PLACED ON FILE

VIII. Communications and Reports from Other City Officers
1. COF 2024 #161 : A communication was received from Diane LeBlanc, City Clerk, transmitting an update regarding legislative. PLACED ON FILE [Unanimous]
Communication and Report from Other City Officers Printout
a. Updated Hearing Schedule 12.18.2024
b. PENDING HOME RULE PETITIONS DECEMBER 23, 2024
c. 2024-2025 Committee Referral List
d. Pending Zoning Petitions and Municipal Ordinances Chart
Appended Information
Awaiting Report Status Update
ARS-24-30 : Awaiting Report Status Update 12.23.24
a. Awaiting Report Status Update 12.23.24
Awaiting Report List
1. AR-24-31 : Provide an update to the Municipal Facilities Improvement Plan (MFIP) including revised cost estimates to help inform the FY26 and ongoing capital budget priorities in a timely manner.
2. AR-24-53 : at the City of Cambridge assist companies, institutions, and other organizations in adopting truck safety requirements for their fleets and finding trucking vendors who are able to comply by providing an informational resource and publicizing those that comply.
3. AR-24-54 : t the City Manager is hereby requested to work with relevant departments to review Cambridge’s curb cut policies and report back on if they can be improved to help meet the City’s transportation and sustainability goals with some proposed updates and draft ordinance language designating City staff as the final approval authority for curb cuts.
4. AR-24-58 : That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Finance Department, Law Department, and other relevant departments to explore the feasibility of a successor program to Rise Up Cambridge.
5. AR-24-60 : That the City Manager be and is hereby requested to report back to the City Council on the Pathways to Removing Obstacles to Housing (PRO Housing) NOFO as soon as possible.
6. AR-24-62 : The City Manager is requested to work with the Community Development Department to provide an update on the status of the Resident Experiences of Inclusion and Bias in Inclusionary Housing in Cambridge report’s recommendations, including progress on implementation and planned next steps.
7. AR-24-63 : The City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to prominently incorporate recognition of the Massachusett Tribe during key official events, documents, websites, and communications, establish a living memorial in Cambridge that honors the Massachusett Tribe, with special recognition of Sqa Sachem for her leadership and enduring legacy and place a plaque with this language in a prominent location within City Hall, ensuring that this acknowledgment remains visible and lasting and report back.
8. AR-24-64 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to prepare a Home Rule Petition to enact legislation which would allow the City of Cambridge to prohibit associations from unreasonably restricting the use of a solar energy system.
9. AR-24-65 : The City Manager is requested to work with the Law Department to draft a home rule petition for the creation of a Cambridge Jobs Training Trust, and report back to the City Council in a timely manner.
10. AR-24-66 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to prepare a draft home rule petition to authorize the City of Cambridge to implement automated parking enforcement technology; and to continue to work with the City of Boston to collaborate on the home rule process.
11. AR-24-67 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to review with a robust and inclusive community process the Cambridge Bicycle Plan, most recently updated in 2020, and identify potential improvements and consider next steps for a network of Separated Bicycle Facilities, and Separated Bicycle Facilities on streets across the city in order to facilitate safer travel and ways to coordinate routes with neighboring communities including Arlington, Somerville, Watertown, Belmont, Boston, and others.
12. AR-24-68 : The City Manager is requested to work with the Traffic, Parking and Transportation Department and Harvard University to restore Garden Street to two-way automobile traffic while preserving two-way protected bike lanes, preserving as much parking on and/or near Garden Street as possible and identifying potential areas for resident parking on neighboring streets and communicating the changes to the affected neighborhood.
13. AR-24-69 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments and encourage the state Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection and the MBTA to adhere to Cambridge local ordinances, including the Cambridge Asbestos Protection Ordinance, during Alewife Construction.
Adjournment
